definition: ode/eulogy/to praise in writing/to wish (in letters)

sentences.english: After class, I always review lessons and sing some chants.
sentences.chinese: 死啊课后，我总会复习课文然后唱一些颂歌。

sentences.english: He first collected women's landays in his native Kunar River Valley.
sentences.chinese: 他首次收录妇女们的颂歌是在他的故乡库纳尔河峡谷。

sentences.english: To dedicate a collective song to the fight against hunger in the world.
sentences.chinese: 为战胜世界饥饿的斗争奉献一首集体颂歌。

sentences.english: Many well-known Christmas carols were composed during this period.
sentences.chinese: 许多著名的圣诞颂歌也是在这一时期创作的。

sentences.english: And he tries to "prevent" them with his humble ode.
sentences.chinese: 弥尔顿努力想用谦逊的颂歌来“阻止“他们。

sentences.english: The children went carolling during the week before Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节前一周，孩子们到各家各户去唱圣诞颂歌。

sentences.english: The carolling of Christmas songs echo through the air.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞颂歌回响在空气中。

sentences.english: However , the practice of caroling actually began hundreds of years earlier.
sentences.chinese: 然而，颂歌的习俗从几百年前就开始了。

sentences.english: She wrote hymns to the gods in cuneiform.
sentences.chinese: 她用楔形文字写下了献给神祇的颂歌。

sentences.english: Would you sing one with me?
sentences.chinese: 你愿意和我一起唱一下圣诞颂歌吗？

sentences.english: They often went carolling at Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 他们在圣诞节时常去挨门挨户地唱圣诞颂歌。

sentences.english: As the chant continued he stared at the seneschal, who still stood beside him.
sentences.chinese: 随着颂歌的继续他盯着总管看，他还站在他的边上。

sentences.english: The brooks sing carols and glees to the spring.
sentences.chinese: 小溪也在对着春天尽情歌唱欢乐颂歌。

sentences.english: Now to the Lord sing praises.
From Milton's first major poem, the Nativity Ode.
sentences.chinese: 他第一首重要诗作《降生颂歌》中看出来。

definition: to sing the praises of/to extol/to eulogize
a poem/a composition in verse/fig. epic (compared with historical epic)/the biblical Book of Psalms
variant of 頌詞|颂词[song4 ci2]
to sing loudly/fig. to mouth slogans
